faq.faq1q: How does the free trial work?
faq.faq1a: When you sign up for any paid plan, you get full access to all features in that tier for 30 days -- no credit card required. At the end of the trial, you can choose to subscribe or your account will automatically downgrade to the Community tier. No data is lost.
faq.faq2q: Can I switch plans at any time?
faq.faq2a: Absolutely. You can upgrade or downgrade your plan at any point. When upgrading, you get immediate access to the new features and we prorate the difference. When downgrading, the change takes effect at the start of your next billing cycle.
faq.faq3a: A machine is any device or server running the Panguard agent. This includes workstations, laptops, cloud VMs, and bare-metal servers. Containers within a single host count as one machine. Deactivated agents do not count toward your limit.
faq.faq4q: Do you offer annual billing discounts?
faq.faq4a: Yes. Annual billing saves you 20% compared to monthly pricing. For example, Solo drops from $9/mo to $7.20/mo, Pro from $29/mo to $23.20/mo, and Business from $79/mo to $63.20/mo -- all billed annually.
faq.faq5q: Is the Community plan really free?
faq.faq5a: Yes, forever. Panguard is open source (MIT). The Community plan includes full security scanning, real-time Layer 1 protection, and community support for 1 machine. When you need multi-machine support, AI defense, or compliance reports, upgrade starting at $9/mo.
faq.faq6a: Available on Pro and Business plans. Generate Taiwan Cyber Security Act ($299), ISO 27001 ($499), SOC 2 ($699), or bundle all three ($999). Reports are AI-powered gap analysis delivered in PDF + JSON format.
faq.faq7q: What happens to my data if I cancel?
faq.faq7a: Your data remains accessible in read-only mode for 30 days after cancellation. During that window, you can export all reports, logs, and configurations. After 30 days, data is securely deleted in accordance with our data retention policy and GDPR requirements.
faq.faq8q: How does the compliance report quality compare to a human consultant?
faq.faq8a: Panguard compliance reports cover all 93 controls in ISO 27001, automatically scanning your system configuration and assessing each control. Report format meets audit standards. However, we recommend using the report as a starting point, working with your internal team or external consultant to complete the final certification process.

technology.title: Security that
technology.subtitle: A three-layer AI defense funnel, five autonomous agents, and a context memory that learns your environment. Built so the 90 % of events that are noise cost nothing, and the 3 % that matter get the deepest reasoning available.

defenseFunnel.title: Three layers. 90 % free.
defenseFunnel.subtitle: Events flow downward through increasingly powerful -- and increasingly expensive -- analysis layers. The funnel ensures cost efficiency while guaranteeing that no genuine threat is missed.

layer1.name: Rule Engine
layer1.desc: Open-source Sigma and YARA rules form the bedrock. They process the vast majority of security events instantly, on-device, with zero cost per event. New community rules are pulled daily from curated feeds and automatically compiled into the local engine.

layer2.name: Edge AI
layer2.desc: Events that rules cannot confidently classify are escalated to a local large-language model running on Ollama. This keeps sensitive data on the device, avoids network latency, and adds contextual reasoning without cloud dependency.

layer3.name: Cloud AI
layer3.desc: Only the most ambiguous or novel threats reach cloud AI for deep reasoning. The payload is scrubbed of PII before transmission. Cloud AI returns a structured verdict with a confidence score and a plain-language explanation.

agents.title: Five agents. One mission.
agents.subtitle: Each agent is a specialist. Together they form an autonomous security operations pipeline that detects, analyzes, responds, reports, and communicates -- without human intervention.

detect.name: Detect Agent
detect.desc: Continuously monitors system logs, network traffic, and file-system changes. Applies Sigma and YARA rules in real-time, flagging anomalies the moment they appear. It produces raw event signals enriched with MITRE ATT&CK TTP tags.

analyze.name: Analyze Agent
analyze.desc: Receives flagged events from the Detect Agent and performs multi-step reasoning. It correlates events across time, queries the Context Memory for baseline deviations, and assigns a confidence score from 0 to 100.

respond.name: Respond Agent
respond.desc: Executes response playbooks based on confidence thresholds. High-confidence threats trigger automatic isolation, firewall rule injection, or process termination. Medium-confidence events queue human-review tasks with full context.

report.name: Report Agent
report.desc: Transforms raw incident data into structured reports mapped to ISO 27001, SOC 2, and other frameworks. Generates executive summaries, timeline visualizations, and audit-ready evidence packages automatically.

chat.name: Chat Agent
chat.desc: The human interface. Users ask questions in plain language and receive answers backed by real telemetry. Integrated with LINE, Slack, and Telegram. Sends proactive weekly summaries and real-time breach notifications.

contextMemory.title: Seven days to learn you. Then it never forgets.
contextMemory.desc1: During the first seven days after installation, Panguard silently observes your system: normal network patterns, typical process trees, expected cron schedules, and standard user behaviour. This builds a per-device baseline stored in an encrypted local database.
contextMemory.desc2: After the learning window, any deviation from baseline is scored and flagged. The model continually refines itself -- a new legitimate service gets adopted into the baseline within hours, while a novel attack pattern triggers escalation immediately.

high.label: Auto-respond

medium.label: Notify & Review
medium.desc: Medium-confidence events trigger a notification to the designated human reviewer via Chat Agent. Full context and AI reasoning are attached so the reviewer can approve or dismiss in one click.

low.label: Log & Learn
low.desc: Low-confidence signals are logged with full metadata and fed into the Context Memory system. Over time, the baseline model refines itself and these signals either graduate to higher bands or are suppressed as noise.

collectiveIntelligence.desc1: When a Panguard agent identifies a previously unknown threat, an anonymous indicator of compromise (IOC) is contributed to the collective intelligence network. Within minutes, every other Panguard agent receives the new signature.
collectiveIntelligence.desc2: This creates a feedback loop: the more devices in the network, the faster new threats are caught, and the stronger every individual agent becomes. A small business with one server benefits from threat data generated across the entire Panguard fleet.
